content: Write a poem about summer with exactly 40 words.

Summer's warmth embraces the land,
Sun kisses petals, golden sand.
Laughter fills the azure sky,
Children play 'neath the cotton-candy pie.

Breezes dance with leaves so green,
Ice creams melt, memories serene.
Evening skies paint hues so bright,
Summer's love, a endless light.

But as days wane, shadows grow,
Summer's end, a whispered vow.
Yet in hearts, its spirit stays,
Until next year, in sun-kissed days.
